name: Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
description: Look closely. Look again. The sights and sounds of Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, an International Biosphere Reserve, reveal a thriving community of plants and animals. Human stories echo throughout the Sonoran Desert, chronicling thousands of years of desert living. A wilderness hike, a scenic drive, or a night of camping will expose you to a living desert abounding with hidden life.
shortDescription: Look closely. Look again. The sights and sounds of Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, an International Biosphere Reserve, reveal a thriving community of plants and animals. Human stories echo throug...

operatingHours.description:
The monument is open 365 days a year and park roads and trails are open 24 hours. There is no gate at the monument entrance; entrance fees are paid for at the visitor center. There is no dispersed camping allowed anywhere in the monument. US-Mexico Border hours are 6 am-8 pm.

The main season for visitors is December through the end of April, during the mild winter months and wildflower season. Campgrounds may fill during this time; check Recreation.gov for campsite availability.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. This fee includes all occupants of a non-commercial vehicle.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. This fee applies to bicycles and walk-ins (per person)

climate.weatherDescription: Summer months are hot, with temperatures exceeding 100F during the day and night-time temperatures in the high 70's. Winter months are milder, with temperatures in the 70s during the day and 30's to 40's in the evening.

images.title: Organ Pipe Cactus at sunset
images.altText: Organ pipe cactus and mountains at sunset
images.caption: Visit the only place in the U.S. where you can see large stands of organ pipe cacti.

images.title: Organ Pipe Cactus
images.altText: sun setting on a green organ pipe cactus
images.caption: Experience the only place in the US where the Organ Pipe Cactus naturally grows

images.title: Scenic views in Alamo Canyon
images.altText: View of Alamo Canyon trail, flanked by saguaros and vegetation with mountains in background
images.caption: Capture amazing views from trails and scenic drives

images.title: Sonoran Pronghorn
images.altText: Sonoran pronghorn with cholla stuck to its face
images.caption: Experience the wildlife of the most biodiverse desert in North America

images.title: Blooming saguaro cactus
images.altText: A saguaro cactus with white blooms, with reddish mountains in the background
images.caption: Experience the rich assemblage of cacti at Organ Pipe Cactus.
